DEFAULT.question: Can I withdraw my fixed deposit before maturity?
DEFAULT.answer:
Premature withdrawal of fixed deposits is not allowed for tax-saver deposits and monthly interest payout deposits.

Any other type of fixed deposit can be withdrawn before maturity. Please refer to the â€˜FD Detailsâ€™ section of any fixed deposit for premature penalty information.

DEFAULT.question: How to withdraw/redeem my fixed deposit?
DEFAULT.answer:
- Press the â€˜DASHBOARDâ€™ button below
- Next to the fixed deposit you want to withdraw, click on the menu with 3 dots
- Click on 'withdraw'
- Review if any penalty charges are applicable
- Proceed to confirm

Note: Currently, you can only withdraw the entire deposit amount on Groww and not a part of it.

Tax Saver.question: Can I withdraw a tax-saver FD before the maturity date?
Tax Saver.answer: No, you canâ€™t withdraw tax-saver deposits as they have a lock-in period of 5 years (minimum).

Equitas Bank.question: How to withdraw/redeem my Equitas Bank fixed deposit?
Equitas Bank.answer:
- Press the â€˜DEPOSITSâ€™ button below
- Next to the fixed deposit you want to withdraw, click on the menu with 3 dots
- Click on 'withdraw'
- Review if any penalty charges are applicable
- Proceed to confirm

Note: Currently, you can only withdraw the entire deposit amount on Groww and not a part of it.

Equitas Bank.question: When will there be no penalty on premature withdrawals for Equitas Bank fixed deposit?
Equitas Bank.answer:
No penalty will be applicable if your fixed deposit is more than 6 months old.

Note: Premature withdrawal is not applicable for tax-saver deposits.

Equitas Bank.question: Whatâ€™s the penalty for premature withdrawal of Equitas Bank fixed deposit?
Equitas Bank.answer:
A penalty of 1% on the applicable interest rate is applicable if your fixed deposit is less than 6 months old. After 6 months, no penalty will be charged for premature withdrawal.

Note: Premature withdrawal is not applicable for tax-saver deposits.

Bajaj Finance.question: What is the penalty of closing FD prematurely for Bajaj Finance Limited?
Bajaj Finance.answer:
- Up to 3 Months â€“ no withdrawal (lock-in period) 
- 3 to 6 Months â€“ 0% interest
- 6 to < 12 Months â€“ 3% lower than the lowest rate specified by Bajaj Finance at the time of placing the deposit
- 12 Months & above â€“ 2% lower than the rate specified for the period for which the deposit has run

Bajaj Finance.question: Can I withdraw my Bajaj Finance FD through Groww?
Bajaj Finance.answer: Currently, you can't withdraw Bajaj Finance FD online through Groww.

Bajaj Finance.question: My issue is not listed here.
Bajaj Finance.answer: You can try searching for your issue. Alternatively you can raise a ticket with us. Our Customer Support champs will help you out in no time!
